description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission ref: 164015FUL dated 20.04.2017 for Redevelopment of the site to provide a 5-22 storey perimeter building to accommodate commercial floorspace at ground floor (mixture of Land Use Classes D2, A1,A3 and B1) and 302 residential units, amenity space at 1st, 5th and 9th floors, car and cycle parking, refuse storage, vehicular access to the east of the site, landscaping and lighting. Variation seeks to propose minor external alterations and amend internal layout and approved plans involving an increase to the building height, including an additional storey to the main building; infill extensions; the addition of 1,037 sqm of commercial floorspace and 11 residential units
decision_conditions: Time Limit 3 years - Full Permission
The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans and Documents

L101 Site Context Plan, L102 Aerial Photograph Plan, L103 Topographical Features Plan, L104 Townscape Character - Existing, L-105 Townscape Character Future, L106 Visual Appraisal Plan, PL-SP Site Location Plan, Ground Floor DG-A-0050-D, Mezzanine Floor DG-A-0051-D, First Floor DG-A-0052-E, Second Floor DG-A-0053-E, Third Floor DG-A-0054-E, Fourth Floor DG-A-0055-E, Fifth Floor DG-A-0056-E, Sixth Floor DG-A-0057-E, Seventh Floor DG-A-058-E, Eighth Floor DG-A-0059-D, Ninth Floor DG-A-0060-D, Tenth Floor DG-A-0061-D, Eleventh Floor DG-A-0062-D, Twelfth Floor DG-A-0063-D, Thirteenth Floor DG-A-0064-D, Fourteenth Floor DG-A-0065-D, Fifteenth Floor DG-A-0066-D, Sixteenth Floor DG-A-0067-D, Seventeenth Floor DG-A-0068-D, Eighteenth Floor DG-A-0069-D, Nineteenth Floor DG-A-0070-D, Twentieth Floor DG-A-0071-D, Twenty First Floor DG-A-0072-D, Twenty Second Floor DG-A-0073-D, Roof Plan DG-A-0074-A, DG-A-0082-D Proposed External Elevation (South), DG-A-0083-D Proposed External Elevation (West), DG-A-0080-D Proposed External Elevation (North), DG-A-0081-D Proposed External Elevation (East), DG-A-0088-D Proposed Internal Elevation (West), DG-A-0084-E Proposed Internal Elevation (North), DG-A-0085-D Proposed Internal Elevation (East), DG-A-0086-D Proposed Internal Elevation (South), DG-A-0087-D Proposed Internal Elevation (South), PL-SP & MCA0117/04C, BW/1410038 Topographical Survey, 1620002448-SK-001 Outline Surface Water Drainage Strategy, Site Plan 3727/0096 - General Arrangement North East Quadrant, DG-A-0097: substation and generator enclosures, MCA0117-07D, MCA0117-02O, MCA0117-04C, MCA0117-03J, West Works Accommodation Schedule (October 2017), Planning Statement (August 2016), Planning Statement Addendum (August 2017), Design and Access Statement (August 2016), Design and Access Statement Addendum (August 2017), Arboricultural Impact Assessment (August 2016), Sustainability Statement  (August 2016), Sustainability Statement  Addendum (June 2017), Energy Statement (August 2016), Energy Statement Addendum (June 2017), Daylight & Sunlight Assessment (August 2016), Daylight & Sunlight Assessment Addendum (August 2017), Contaminated Land Risk Assessment (August 2016), Noise & Vibration Assessment (June 2016), Noise & Vibration Assessment Addendum (August 2017), Townscape & Visual Impact Assessment (August 2016), Appendix A.1: TVIA Methodology (August 2016), Overheating Assessment (August 2016), Overheating Analysis Note (July 2017),  Transport Assessment (August 2016), Transport Assessment Addendum (August 2017), Flood Risk Assessment (August 2016), Drainage Assessment Form (August 2016) and Surface Water Drainage Design Statement (August 2016), CA_3135_TR001A, A_3135_TR001A, Construction Management Plan (July 2017), Travel Plan (October 2017), Parking Management Plan (July 2017), Crane Operator Plan (July 2017), Delivery & Servicing Plan (November 2017).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Details of Materials - Building
The development hereby permitted shall be built using the following materials and finishes for all external surfaces of the building:

PL-SP, Materials boards samples by Redrow Homes and 'Updated Materials Pack' by Redrow dated October 2017 detailing: 01 'Hoskins Corum 164 Facing Brick with cemex dove white mortar', 02 'Wienerberger Terca Ashington Red Multi Facing Brick with cemex light brown morter', 03 'Pura Facades OKO Skin/Fibre GRC Cladding with silver grey matt finish', 04 'Pura Facades OKO Skin/Fibre GRC Cladding with anthracite matt finish', 05 'Pura Facades OKO Skin/Fibre GRC Cladding with terracotta matt finish', 06 'Ideal Combi Aluminium/Timber composite windows and doors with RAL7021 finish', 07 'Polyester powder coated mild steel metal work with RAL7021 finish', 08 'Hardscape Pembroke Flags with Black Granite finish', 09 'Hardscape Pembroke Flags with Silver Granite finish', 10 'Marshalls Conservation Slabs with Silver Grey finish & 11 'Marshalls La linia Block Paving with Mid Grey finish',
The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Building Hard/ Soft Landscaping and Boundary Treatment - Building

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the documents listed on this decision letter and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and residential amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, and 7.21 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| Details building's surrounding forecourt (public realm area)

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the documents listed on this decision letter and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality and in the interest of highway safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f)(h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Construction Management Plan

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the Construction Management Plan (August 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
| Car parking and Electric vehicles

The car parking spaces hereby approved shall be fully marked out and the provision of 12 vehicle charging points spaces (6 active and 6 passive) shall be made the prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and these car parking spaces together with the associated access and internal carriageway shall be kept continuously available for the satisfactory operation of the parking area and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety  and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Parking Management Plan

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the Parking Management Plan (August 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: In the interest of an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Size of servicing vehicles
The size of vehicles servicing the development shall be limited to 10m rigid lorries.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety  and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Cycle Parking
The cycle parking facilities hereby approved shall be fully implemented and operational before the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.
| Travel Plan

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the Travel Plan (October 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026.
| Delivery/Servicing Plan

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the Delivery & Servicing Plan (November 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter

Reason: To ensure that the resulting servicing arrangements are satisfactory in terms of their impact on highway safety and the free-flow of traffic in accordance with policies: 6.7 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016. | Deliveries/collections times

Deliveries to and collections from, including waste, the commercial units hereby approved shall only take place during the period 0700 - 1800 hrs on Monday to Saturday, at no times on Sunday  and Public Holidays.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g) and 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 4.7, 7.1 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Opening hours commercial units

The commercial unit hereby approved shall be opened to customers from 0800 to 2000 hrs Monday to Friday, 0800 to 1800 hrs on Saturday, at no times on Sundays and public holidays. All activity shall cease 30 minutes after closing times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g)  (j) and 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 4.7, 7.1 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| BREAAM Standards

Each new non-residential element of the development shall be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent (based on the latest BREEAM Technical guidance).

(A) No less than 3 months of the completion of each non-residential element of the development, evidence that the development is registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the most up to date BREEAM Technical Guidance and Interim BREEAM Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

(B) Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of each non-residential element of the development, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE, should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
| Energy Strategy

A) Within three-months of the first occupation of each residential and non-residential component within the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/BER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential and non-residential component within the approved development evidence that the renewable/low carbon technology(ies) are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

C) Prior to occupation of the development including residential and non-residential components, the approved development shall incorporate, maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 36.02% (equal to 197.1 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017) and supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) prepared by Method Consulting.:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 12.7 tonnes CO2 equating to 2.31% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii.	incorporation of onsite gas fired Combined Heat & Power (CHP) of at least 33kWe/66kWth, if connection to an offsite heat network is unavailable, to provide at least 72% space heating and hot water to all dwellings and hot water to the non-residential units and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 177.4 tonnes CO2 equating to 33.19% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case.

iii.	incorporation of at least 12.6kWp solar PV system to generate at least 13.64MWh/year electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 7.08 tonnes CO2 equating to 1.98% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated and maintained in line with approved Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017), supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) and Sustainability Statement Addendum Rev A (07 August 2017) prepared by Method Consulting and Sustainability Statement Rev 2 (04 August 2016) prepared by Hodkinson Consultancy.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that all components within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Sustainability for residential and non-residential (incorporates condition 21 of original planning permission):

(A) Prior to the first occupation of each non-residential element, the approved non-domestic spaces shall incorporate and maintain energy and sustainability measures that are in line or improve upon those stated and approved under the Sustainability Statement Rev 2 (04 August 2016) & Energy Strategy V.2 (03 August 2016) prepared by Hodkinson Consultancy and Sustainability Statement Addendum Rev A (07 August 2017) & Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017) and supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) prepared by Method Consulting.

(B) Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved domestic units shall incorporate and maintain sustainability measures in line with the Sustainability Statement Rev 2 (04 August 2016) & Energy Strategy V.2 (03 August 2016) prepared by Hodkinson Consultancy and Sustainability Statement Addendum Rev A (07 August 2017) & Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017) and supplementary information (02 November 2017) prepared by Method Consulting.

Reason:  To ensure that the residential and non-residential components of the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Combined Heat and Power (CHP) facility

Prior to occupation of the first 127 residential units and in the event that sourcing heat off-site to primarily supply the proposed development with space heating and hot water and/or cooling is not available at that time, details of the gas combined heat and power facility, which shall be accommodated in a single onsite energy centre with minimum floor area of 170 sq.m. and provide for no less than that which  is required by condition 16 (if an on-site energy centre is provided); as detailed within approved Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017) and supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) prepared by Method Consulting including:
a) operational data and performance and QI rating,
b) specification and operation/management strategy;
c) flue location, height and design.

shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the energy centre shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the first 127 residential units dwelling within the development hereby approved.

The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:    To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies with policies 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy LV5.2 of the Ealing Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Energy Centre / temporary plant rooms - district heating
Prior to the first occupation of the approved development the following details should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:
a)	Evidence of investigation of ways of heat imported to the site and briefings of discussions with neighbouring developers.

b)	details of the layout of the energy plant room and equipment and the method of how the facility shall be designed to allow future            connection to an offsite district heating network, if an on-site energy centre is provided;
c)	details of the temporary plant room(s), including their size and layout, size of boilers;

d)	details of the pipe network (including the size and route, flow and return temperatures, total length of the heat network in metres            (flow and return) distribution and transmission, diagram route, total plant heating capacity, total heat generated, total heat supplied             to premises) for the connection of all domestic and non-domestic elements into the site wide district heating network.
e)	Consideration of the installation of a point of external connection within the energy centre, if an on-site energy centre is provided

f)	All boilers and CHP units accommodated in the on-site energy centre, if provided, to serve the energy requirements of the            development should use Ultra low-NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions that are compliant with the NOx (g/m²) benchmarks            as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
g)	details to demonstrate that the district heating network shall be designed in accordance with Heat Networks: Code of Practice for             the UK.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To secure the measures set out within the approved revised Energy Strategy Statement and to ensure that the school development energy plant room is designed in a manner which allows for the future connection to the Green Man Lane an offsite district heat network, and to ensure that the development contributes to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy LV5.2 of the Ealing Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Renewable/Low Carbon (&CO2) Energy Monitoring

Upon final completion of each phase of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring either the renewable/low-carbon energy technology(ies) or heat and electricity imported into the site shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2016, the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Overheating analysis for both domestic and non-domestic elements

Prior to the first occupation of the development (including residential and non-residential components), the approved development shall incorporate and maintain mitigation measures that will assist with reducing the risk of overheating, follow the Cooling Hierarchy and comply with CIBSE TM49 & TM52 criteria as stated in the Thermal Comfort Analysis Report Rev P1 (14 July 2017) and Thermal Comfort Analysis Report Rev P2 prepared by Method Consulting.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Security features

Prior to occupation taking place, details of the security measures to be incorporated into the development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details should incorporate the following information:
a)	Location, access and design of post-boxes;
b)	Design, location and details of access restrictions to communal core entry systems;
c)	Confirmation that accessible windows and doors would meet the PAS 24 standards;
d)	Location and view-path of CCTV (where relevant); and
e)	Any other security features.
The agreed security features shall be installed and be operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant section of development.

Reason:  To ensure that the adequate security features are incorporated into the development that are appropriate to the overall design of the buildings and are adequate to promote safety and security, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies LV7.3 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Noise Mitigation

The insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation, screening for external amenity areas where necessary and attenuation of building services plant and mitigation of vibration shall be incorporated in the construction of the development and fully completed prior to occupation, the noise mitigation measures incorporated  will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms to the Local Planning Authority standards; including the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwellings above.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Plant Noise Mitigation

The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Building emissions
The development shall comply with current air quality neutral building emissions benchmarks for the residential and commercial uses hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of improving air quality in the Borough, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan 2016.
| Site contamination

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the details approved under ref. 171993CND, documents listed on this decision letter, and any drawings approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016), policy 1.1( j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework, DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11' and BS1075:2011+A1:2013.
| Submission of Remediation Scheme

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the details approved under ref. 171988CND, documents listed on this decision letter, and any drawings approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| Implementation of Approved Remediation Scheme

The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development other than that required to carry out remediation, demolition of existing buildings and site preparation.  The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.

Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report (and or validation report) that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted to and approved in writing Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), the National Planning Policy Framework and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.
| External lighting

External lighting serving the development hereby approved shall  comply with the advice given at BS 5489_1: 2003 Code of practice for the design of road lighting - Part 1: Lighting of roads and public amenity areas and ILP guidance notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011 and shall be fully installed and operational before the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained in working order thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.1 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Play equipment

The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the documents listed on this decision letter and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To ensure that there is suitable provision for childrens play facilities within the site  in accordance with policies 1.1 (e), 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 3.5 and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, and 3.6 of the London Plan (2016), the London Plan SPG on Chidren's Play and Recreation, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015, or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), the commercial unit hereby approved shall not b
